result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dorothy T Goodloe in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State recommends this be amended to a county ordinance- possession
Plea - NC.

$100+cc, pp $25/mo beg 10/1/15 , ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.

Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
in support of motion to w/draw.

Defendant Dorothy T Goodloe in court with attorney John William Campion.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Parties have come to an agreement on resolution of the cases.
Deft is to engage in treatment.
Parties are requesting a status date out to August.
ZCI report should be completed prior to the next status date.
Def is moving to w/draw from the matters today, someone else from the office will be taking the cases.
BTC: Motion to w/draw is granted, Matter adjourned. Deft must make payment arrangements with ZCI.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dorothy T Goodloe in court with attorney John William Campion.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
